intro: Gnaphalium nodiflorum, commonly known as the clustered everlasting or nodding everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant is also noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
